result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charleigh Tasheena Clause

records.addlTxt: 10:12 AM Defendant Charleigh Tasheena Clause appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Charleigh Tasheena Clause.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.  Plea Questionnaire submitted to Court.   State recites agreement, all parties agree.    As part of the agreement, Case is dismissed and read in.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

11:51 AM Defendant Charleigh Tasheena Clause appeared by video.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Charleigh Tasheena Clause.  Attorney Kenneth Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 21CF140 / 21CF144 / 22CF39 and recites appearances. Court reviews court record. Atty Chapman provides background of DEF bonds. Atty Chapman request that the bond be modified to a lower cash amount for her CBS bond. State objects to the bond modification. Atty Chapman comments on State's objection. State comments on charges in the case. Court will modify the bond requirement of $1000 CBS with the same conditions of the previous bond. Court adjourns.

1:38 PM Defendant Charleigh Tasheena Clause appeared by video from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Charleigh Tasheena Clause.  Attorney Ken Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Def Atty speaks on bond modification. Atty Chapman having technical difficulties via zoom.  Def Atty fixes the technical difficulty and continues. Def Atty requests modification of bond to remain with signature bond for additional treatment at a different facility. State opposes bond modification. Court addresses the client on treatment, court discussion follows. Court denies motion of bond modification. Clerk to convert the Signature Bond back to a Cash Bond per prior order of bond modification for treatment as DEF has returned back from facility. Court adjourns.
Motion hearing on September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
